item.text: The Lord said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt,

“<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> is to be your <st data-num="07218" class="">beginning</st> of <st data-num="02320">months</st>; <st data-num="01931" class="">it</st> will be your <st data-num="07223" class="">first</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> of the <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="01696" class="">Tell</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, ‘On the <st data-num="06218" class="">tenth</st> day of <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> they <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st><n id="1" /> must <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> a <st data-num="07716" class="">lamb</st><n id="2" /> for themselves according to their <st data-num="01004 01" class="">families</st><n id="3" />—a <st data-num="07716" class="">lamb</st> for each <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st>.<n id="4" />

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> any <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st> is too <st data-num="04591" class="">small</st><n id="1" /> for a <st data-num="07716" class="">lamb</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01931" class="">man</st><n id="3" /> and his <st data-num="07138" class="">next</st>-<st data-num="01004" class="">door</st> <st data-num="07934" class="">neighbor</st><n id="4" /> are to <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st><n id="5" /> a lamb according to the <st data-num="04373" class="">number</st> of <st data-num="05315" class="">people</st>—you will <st data-num="03699" class="">make</st> your <st data-num="03699" class="">count</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="07716" class="">lamb</st> <st data-num="06310" class="">according to</st> how much <st data-num="0376" class="">each one</st> can <st data-num="0400" class="">eat</st>.<n id="6" />

Your <st data-num="07716" class="">lamb</st> must <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08549" class="">perfect</st>,<n id="2" /> a <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st>, one <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> <st data-num="01121">old</st>;<n id="3" /> you may <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st><n id="4" /> it <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="03532" class="">sheep</st> or <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="05795" class="">goats</st>.

You must <st data-num="01961 04931">care for</st> it<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="0702 06240" class="">fourteenth</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> of <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>, and then the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="06951 05712" class="">community</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> will <st data-num="07819" class="">kill</st> it <st data-num="0996" class="">around</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">sundown</st>.<n id="3" />

They will <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="04201" class="">side posts</st> and <st data-num="04947" class="">top of the doorframe</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">houses</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> they will <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it.

They will <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> the <st data-num="02088" class="">same</st> <st data-num="03915">night</st>;<n id="1" /> they will <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it <st data-num="06748" class="">roasted</st> over the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> with <st data-num="04682" class="">bread made without yeast</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04844" class="">bitter herbs</st>.

Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it <st data-num="04995" class="">raw</st><n id="1" /> or <st data-num="01310" class="">boiled</st> in <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, <st data-num="03588 0518">but</st> <st data-num="06748" class="">roast</st> it over the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> with its <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>, its <st data-num="03767" class="">legs</st>, and its <st data-num="07130" class="">entrails</st>.

You must <st data-num="03498" class="">leave</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">nothing</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st>, but you must <st data-num="08313" class="">burn</st> with <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> whatever <st data-num="03498" class="">remains</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> it <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st>.
This is how you are to eat it—dressed to travel, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand. You are to eat it in haste. It is the Lord’s Passover.

“‘I will pass through the land of Egypt in the same night, and I will attack all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both of humans and of animals, and on all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment. I am the Lord.
The blood will be a sign for you on the houses where you are, so that when I see the blood I will pass over you, and this plague will not fall on you to destroy you when I attack the land of Egypt.
“‘This day will become a memorial for you, and you will celebrate it as a festival to the Lord—you will celebrate it perpetually as a lasting ordinance.

For seven days you must eat bread made without yeast. Surely on the first day you must put away yeast from your houses because anyone who eats bread made with yeast from the first day to the seventh day will be cut off from Israel.

“‘On the first day there will be a holy convocation, and on the seventh day there will be a holy convocation for you. You must do no work of any kind on them, only what every person will eat—that alone may be prepared for you.

So you will <st data-num="08104" class="">keep</st> the <st data-num="04682" class="">Feast of Unleavened Bread</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> on <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="06106" class="">very</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> I <st data-num="03318" class="">brought</st> your <st data-num="06635" class="">regiments</st><n id="2" /> out from the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, and so you must <st data-num="08104" class="">keep</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> <st data-num="01755" class="">perpetually</st> as a <st data-num="05769" class="">lasting</st> <st data-num="02708" class="">ordinance</st>.<n id="3" />

In the <st data-num="07223" class="">first</st> month,<n id="1" /> from the <st data-num="0702 06240" class="">fourteenth</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> of the <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>, in the <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>, you will <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="04682" class="">bread made without yeast</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="0259 06242" class="">twenty-first</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> of the <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> in the <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>.

For <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07603" class="">yeast</st> must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="04672" class="">found</st> in your <st data-num="01004" class="">houses</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">whoever</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eats</st> <st data-num="02557" class="">what is made with yeast</st>—<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">person</st><n id="2" /> will be <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> from the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, whether a <st data-num="01616" class="">resident foreigner</st><n id="3" /> or <st data-num="0249" class="">one born</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.
You will not eat anything made with yeast; in all the places where you live you must eat bread made without yeast.’”
Then Moses summoned all the elders of Israel, and told them, “Go and select for yourselves a lamb or young goat for your families, and kill the Passover animals.

<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> a <st data-num="092" class="">branch</st> of <st data-num="0231" class="">hyssop</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02881" class="">dip</st> it in the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> is in the <st data-num="05592" class="">basin</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="05060" class="">apply</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04947" class="">top of the doorframe</st> and the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="04201" class="">side posts</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> is in the <st data-num="05592" class="">basin</st>. <st data-num="03808" class="">Not</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> is to <st data-num="03318" class="">go out</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="06607" class="">door</st> of his <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st>.

For the Lord will pass through to strike Egypt, and when he sees the blood on the top of the doorframe and the two side posts, then the Lord will pass over the door, and he will not permit the destroyer to enter your houses to strike you.

You must <st data-num="08104" class="">observe</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">event</st> as an <st data-num="02706" class="">ordinance</st> for you and for your <st data-num="01121" class="">children</st> <st data-num="05704 05769">forever</st>.
When you enter the land that the Lord will give to you, just as he said, you must observe this ceremony.

<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">children</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">ask</st> you, ‘<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> does <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05656" class="">ceremony</st> mean to you?’<n id="1" />—

then you will say, ‘It is the sacrifice of the Lord’s Passover, when he passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt, when he struck Egypt and delivered our households.’” The people bowed down low to the ground,
and the Israelites went away and did exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron.

It happened at midnight—the Lord attacked all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the prison, and all the firstborn of the cattle.

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">got up</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01931" class="">along</st> with <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="04713" class="">Egypt</st>, and there <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> a <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="06818" class="">cry</st> in <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">there was no</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="08033" class="">in</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">there was not</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">someone dead</st>.
Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron in the night and said, “Get up, get out from among my people, both you and the Israelites! Go, serve the Lord as you have requested!
Also, take your flocks and your herds, just as you have requested, and leave. But bless me also.”
The Egyptians were urging the people on, in order to send them out of the land quickly, for they were saying, “We are all dead!”

So the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">took</st> their <st data-num="01217" class="">dough</st> <st data-num="02962" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="02556" class="">yeast was added</st>,<n id="1" /> with their <st data-num="04863" class="">kneading troughs</st> <st data-num="06887" class="">bound up</st> in their <st data-num="08071" class="">clothing</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> their <st data-num="07926" class="">shoulders</st>.

Now the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st><n id="1" /> as <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">told</st> them—they had <st data-num="07592" class="">requested</st> from the <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptians</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">items</st> and <st data-num="08071" class="">clothing</st>.
The Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, and they gave them whatever they wanted, and so they plundered Egypt.
The Israelites journeyed from Rameses to Sukkoth. There were about 600,000 men on foot, plus their dependents.

A <st data-num="06154" class="">mixed</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">multitude</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> them, and <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st> and <st data-num="01241" class="">herds</st>—a <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="03515" class="">large number</st> of <st data-num="04735" class="">cattle</st>.<n id="2" />

They baked cakes of bread without yeast using the dough they had brought from Egypt, for it was made without yeast. Because they were thrust out of Egypt and were not able to delay, they could not prepare food for themselves either.
Now the length of time the Israelites lived in Egypt was 430 years.
At the end of the 430 years, on the very day, all the regiments of the Lord went out of the land of Egypt.
It was a night of vigil for the Lord to bring them out from the land of Egypt, and so on this night all Israel is to keep the vigil to the Lord for generations to come.
The Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “This is the ordinance of the Passover. No foreigner may share in eating it.

But <st data-num="03605 0376" class="">everyone’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> who is <st data-num="04736" class="">bought</st> for <st data-num="03701" class="">money</st>, after you have <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st> him, may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it.
A <st data-num="08453" class="">foreigner</st> and a <st data-num="07916" class="">hired worker</st> must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it.

It must be <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> in <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>; you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">any</st> of the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>, and you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07665">break</st> a <st data-num="06106" class="">bone</st> of it.
The whole community of Israel must observe it.

“When a resident foreigner lives with you and wants to observe the Passover to the Lord, all his males must be circumcised, and then he may approach and observe it, and he will be like one who is born in the land—but no uncircumcised person may eat of it.
The same law will apply to the person who is native-born and to the resident foreigner who lives among you.”
So all the Israelites did exactly as the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron.
And on this very day the Lord brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt by their regiments.
